page.title: 03Common Land (2)
page.content:
Graziers pay Â£33 per year per head but house owners or tenant of 99 houses in the High Street can graze 2 cows and 1horse free of charge. These people are called Commoners. This priviledge was granted by an ancient charter in the 13th century.
12 acres of common are leased by the Town and Manor Trustees as a public recreational area. This consists of a cricket pitch,football pitch, swimming pool and a static playground for children. Rugby football is played on a adjoining area.
An Avenue of Remembrance commemorates 28 lives lost in 1939-45 war. There is a large sarsen stone,seats and 28 trees, one for each person who died fighting for their country.
